meanings.definition: A tendency to oversimplify complex issues or problems.
meanings.sent1: His simplism led him to ignore important details in the project.
meanings.sent2: The article criticized the author's simplism in addressing the economic crisis.
meanings.sent3: She chuckled at his simplism when he suggested solving world hunger with a single recipe.
meanings.sent4: Her simplism was like trying to fit a square peg into a round hole.
meanings.sent5: The teacher used a funny puppet show to explain simplism in science class.

meanings.definition: The belief that things can be made simpler than they really are.
meanings.sent1: His simplism made him think all problems had easy solutions.
meanings.sent2: She often fell into the trap of simplism, thinking life could be uncomplicated.
meanings.sent3: The group's simplism about fixing the broken car with duct tape made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: Her simplism was like trying to paint a rainbow with just one color.
meanings.sent5: The child's simplism about bedtime stories made them all the more enchanting.
